ref: 797 ávabharatē ʻ sinks into ʼ, ˚ti ʻ throws into ʼ RV. Some confusion prob. with avaharatē ʻ brings down ʼ KātyŚr. since from Pk. onwards cmpds. of bhr̥ -- and hr̥ -- collide phonet. [√bhr̥]
Pk. ōharia -- ʻ brought down, descended ʼ;
B. olā ʻ to descend ʼ, caus. olāna (if not < avalīyatē or with Chatterji ODBL 413 < *avalabh -- );
Or. ohaḷibā ʻ to be hanging ʼ, caus. ohaḷāibā, ohaḷ ʻ hanging roots of banyan tree ʼ, di
al. uhlibā ʻ to flow down, float away ʼ;
H. oharnā, uh˚ ʻ to subside (of swelling or flood), to settle (of a liquid) ʼ;
M. oharṇẽ, horṇẽ ʻ to stuff or fill in a cavity, to overspread the body with trinkets, &c. ʼ
